recommended_actions.description: Phantom E session s1263 ran for ~20 seconds, addressed zero directives, and is missing from session-history.txt. directive-outcomes.json logged it but session-history.txt did not. This suggests the post-session summarize hook failed to fire (session too short for hook execution). While this is an isolated incident, ultra-short sessions that bypass session-history logging create blind spots for audit tracking.
recommended_actions.action: B session should investigate why s1263 doesn't appear in session-history.txt. Possible causes: (1) session crashed before post-session hooks ran, (2) heartbeat.sh min-duration gate excluded it. If sessions can bypass history logging, add a fallback: pre-session hook could log session start, ensuring every session gets at least a 'started' entry.

recommended_actions.description: R session directive-outcomes tracking (wq-459 fix) has only 1 data point (s1265 with addressed=[]). The fix is deployed and functional, but R sessions show 0% addressed rate in directive-outcomes because they handle directives via maintenance (editing directives.json) rather than explicitly addressing them. The outcomes hook may not detect this pattern.
recommended_actions.action: Monitor over next audit cycle. After 3+ R sessions are tracked, evaluate whether the outcomes hook needs R-session-specific evidence detection (e.g., detecting directives.json edits as 'addressed'). If R sessions consistently show addressed=[] despite 100% compliance via independent verification, the hook needs adjustment.
